Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei warned in May that AI could wipe out half of entry-level white-collar jobs within five years. Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said in June that AI will reduce the e-commerce giant's corporate workforce and 'change the way our work is done'.

articles.title: ‘OK, Google — how much energy does an AI bot need?'

It uses satellite and street-level images to determine where a device is and which way it is facing. It works even with a simple monocular camera.

articles.summary: ZEISS Medical Technology has announced CE mark approval for CIRRUS PathFinder, an innovative clinical support tool with artificial intelligence (AI) fully integrated to enable more confident decision-making and accelerate a clinician's workflow with OCT interpretation assistance. ZEISS is developing digital diagnostic tools that help streamline workflows.

articles.title: Rezolve Ai to Participate in Citi's 2025 Global TMT Conference
articles.author: Rezolve AI Ltd
articles.summary: Daniel Wagner will participate in a fireside chat at Citi's 2025 Global TMT Conference on September 3, 2025 at 4:10 p.m. Eastern Time. A link to the live audio webcast will be available on Rezolve Ai's Investor Relations website at investor.rezolve.com.

articles.title: Google Wants You to Know the Environmental Cost of Quizzing Its AI
articles.author: Clara Hudson
articles.summary: Every time you ask Google's Gemini a query, it takes the same amount of energy as watching nine seconds of TV. A single text query emits 0.03 grams of carbon dioxide equivalent and consumes about five drops of water, according to Google's new report.

articles.title: Tech Giants Prepare to Challenge State AI Regulations
articles.author: Emily Birnbaum
articles.summary: Tech giants are pushing both the AI-friendly White House and Republican-led Congress to block US states from regulating their fast-moving and lucrative artificial intelligence businesses. Five states, including Texas and California, passed significant AI-related laws. Advocates for the industry want to redirect the regulation to the ways AI is used and away from the development of new AI.

articles.title: Google says a typical AI text prompt only uses 5 drops of water — experts say that's misleading
articles.author: Justine Calma
articles.summary: Google released a study on the environmental impact of its AI chatbot, Gemini. It claims that it uses a minimal amount of water and energy for each text prompt. But experts say that the tech giant's claims are misleading. Google has yet to submit a peer review for its paper.

articles.title: In a first, Google has released data on how much energy an AI prompt uses
articles.author: Casey Crownhart
articles.summary: Google has just released a technical report on the energy consumption of its AI-powered Gemini app. It's the most transparent estimate yet from a Big Tech company with a popular AI product. The report includes detailed information about how the company calculated its final estimate. Google's AI chips account for just 58% of the total electricity demand of 0.24 watt-hours. The rest of the energy is used by equipment needed to support AI-specific hardware, the host machine's CPU and memory, and overhead costs associated with running a data center.

articles.title: In a First, Google Has Released Data on How Much Energy an AI Prompt Uses
articles.summary: It's the most transparent estimate yet from one of the big AI companies. It's a long-awaited peek behind the curtain for researchers. The estimate is based on data from the company's AI system.      Â   .

articles.title: Tech Giants Prepare to Challenge State AI Regulations
articles.summary: Tech companies are pressing the White House and Congress to pass legislation that would block states from regulating artificial intelligence. An attempt to attach a 10-year ban to Trump's tax legislation failed in June. In July, lobbyists successfully pushed for Trump's AI plan to include a dire warning.

articles.title: Olympia asked AI to analyze its budget, and it came up with $28 million in possible cuts
articles.author: Ty Vinson
articles.summary: The City of Olympia is considering using recommendations generated by artificial intelligence (AI) to help steer its future budget decisions. Assistant City Manager Debbie Sullivan said this step is an opportunity to transform the city's budget from being divided by departments to focusing on programs and services. Tyler Technologies has used AI to produce a draft recommendations, opportunities and insights report. The workshop for department heads to discuss their budgets is scheduled for August 26.

articles.title: Brainbase Labs Leverages AWS to Launch Kafka Workforce: a Highly-Specialized AI Employee Platform for Enterprise
articles.author: Brainbase Labs
articles.summary: Kafka Workforce is the first enterprise platform for creating highly-specialized AI employees. Built on Amazon Web Services (AWS), the platform enables enterprises to deploy AI employees that come with their own computer and can be accessed through email, phone and Slack. Brainbase's goal is to create an AI worker that is indistinguishable from a remote human employee.

articles.title: As AI replaces jobs, mining offers a future
articles.author: Rich Nolan Guest columnist
articles.summary: Today's college graduates face a startling reality. Many of the jobs they were hoping for are rapidly disappearing because of artificial intelligence. Mike Rowe of 'Dirty Jobs' fame recently observed that we've been telling kids for 15 years to learn to code. Mark Zuckerberg agrees and predicts that most Meta code will be written by AI in the next 12 to 18 months.

articles.title: Stifel Nicolaus Sticks to Its Buy Rating for Alphabet Class A (GOOGL)
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Stifel Nicolaus analyst Mark Kelley maintained a Buy rating on Alphabet Class A today and set a price target of $222.00. Needham also maintained a buy rating on the stock with a $220.00 price target. The company's shares closed yesterday at $199.32.

articles.title: What AI means for the future of the job market
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: Business leaders have warned about the impact of artificial intelligence on the job market. Experts say the full impact of the technology is yet to be realized, but it will change the way our work is done.      Â   y

articles.title: How Agentic AI Can Rewrite The Role Of Finance
articles.author: Ahsan Shah
articles.summary: Ahsan Shah is the SVP AI & Analytics, Billtrust. He explains how agentic AI can be used to improve the efficiency of finance operations. He also explains how to build the foundation for intelligent finance operations and how to make it more human-like.

articles.title: FieldAI raises funds to advance universal brains for humanoid robots
articles.author: Sujita Sinha
articles.summary: FieldAI, a robotics startup backed by Bill Gates, has raised $405 million in two funding rounds. The fresh capital values the two-year-old company at $2 billion. It has recruited engineers and scientists from DeepMind, Tesla Autopilot, SpaceX, NASA, and Amazon to develop autonomous robots for industries such as construction, energy, manufacturing, construction, urban delivery, and inspection.

articles.title: Educators get new guidance for age of AI
articles.author: Sam Drysdale
articles.summary: Massachusetts education officials on Monday released statewide guidance on how to use artificial intelligence in classrooms. The department stressed that the guidance is not to promote or discourage the use of AI. It is meant to give schools a consistent framework for deciding when, how and why to use AI in ways that are safe, ethical and meaningful.

articles.title: Why You Need To Understand Your Problems Before Building AI Solutions
articles.author: Kelly Starman
articles.summary: Kelly Starman is the chief marketing officer for MasterControl. She explains how to create an AI-first marketing program. She suggests starting with the problem first and then focusing on the solution. She recommends meeting with your leaders weekly to maintain momentum, track progress and establish a productive cadence.

articles.title: The AI Talent Trap: Building Nothing With Everything
articles.author: Ramiro Gonzalez Forcada
articles.summary: According to McKinsey, 78% of organizations report using AI in at least one business function, but only 2% of enterprises are ready to leverage it effectively. AI-related job postings have grown only 21% since 2018, but mentions of "AI" in job listings have surged over 120% in 2024 and another 56% in 2025. Generative AI adoption jumped from 33% to 71% in a year, but few companies have adapted their hiring models or delivery capacity to match that curve.

articles.title: The Human Edge: Why Great Questions Will Define AI Success
articles.author: Anthony Conversa
articles.summary: Anthony Conversa is the Chief Marketing Officer of Cinch Home Services, one of the nation's leading provider of home services solutions. He believes that the key to unlocking AI's value isn't simply access, but curiosity. It's about defining the right use cases, setting clear expectations and trusting instinct over automation.

articles.title: AI Revolutionizes Mental Health Care in Breast Cancer
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence could revolutionize mental health care for patients with breast cancer. Up to half of breast cancer patients will go on to experience anxiety, depression or PTSD. UVA Cancer Center's J. Kim Penberthy, PhD, and colleagues have published their paper in the scientific journal AI in Precision Medicine.

articles.title: UNT researchers to develop AI tool to help solve cold cases, identify human remains
articles.author: Miriam Fauzia
articles.summary: UNT Health Fort Worth received a $2 million grant from the National Institute of Justice to develop an AI-driven software to standardize and streamline how law enforcement and forensic anthropologists build biological profiles of the dead. Kate Lesciotto, an assistant professor of anatomy at UNT Health's College of Biomedical and Translational Sciences, is one of the lead investigators on the project. She and her collaborators will gather skeletal measurements and morphological data from collections in the U.S. and Mexico to improve the accuracy of biological profiles.

articles.title: From Automation To Autonomous Collaboration: The Rise Of Agentic AI
articles.author: Lori Schafer
articles.summary: Lori Schafer is CEO of Digital Wave Technology, an AI/GAI-native platform for master data with RAD for unified enterprise solutions. PwC study predicts AI agents will revolutionize how businesses operate within the next 12 to 24 months. Companies need to prepare their technology architecturally and prepare their organization culturally for the evolution of AI.

articles.title: EDITORIAL: Repeal Colorado's flawed AI law
articles.author: The Gazette editorial board
articles.summary: Colorado's part-time legislature blew its attempt to introduce AI regulations in 2024. The bill that was signed into law was cobbled together with potential pitfalls and overreaches. The law's mere presence in state statute is radioactive to the burgeoning AI industry. A bill to be introduced today, tentatively designated 25B-0012 and sponsored by Sen. Mark Baisley, R-Roxborough Park, would see to that.

articles.title: Tired of meal planning or nagging your spouse? Outsource it to a machine.
articles.author: Lisa Bonos
articles.summary: Brit Kwait, a vegan mother of three in Chicago, outsourced her meal planning to AI app Ollie. Brit Kwait used to feel like a 1950s housewife who'd just used packaged dough for the first time, but in 2025, her kitchen shortcut was an app that used artificial intelligence.

articles.title: What AI means for the future of the job market
articles.author: Julia Shapero
articles.summary: Business leaders warn about the negative impact of artificial intelligence on the labor market. However, experts say the full impact of the technology is yet to be realized. The most AI-exposed workers saw a slight uptick in unemployment, but the least exposed ones saw a rise in unemployment.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg freezes AI hiring amid bubble fears
articles.author: James Titcomb
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg has blocked recruitment of artificial intelligence staff at Meta. The tech giant has frozen hiring across its 'superintelligence labs' with the exception of rare exceptions. It comes after technology shares have tumbled this week, fuelled by concerns that heavy investments in AI are not paying off.

articles.title: Enterprises Are Struggling to Make Generative AI Work. That's Great News for IBM.
articles.author: Timothy Green
articles.summary: IBM's consulting-heavy artificial intelligence (AI) strategy should benefit from this situation. IBM has generated more than $7.5 billion in bookings related to generative AI, but around 80% of that business comes from the company's consulting arm. IBM's AI business is helping to offset weak demand for some discretionary projects. The company expects to generate constant-currency revenue growth of at least 5% this year and free cash flow is expected to grow to $13 billion.

articles.title: Meta Freezes AI Hiring as Surging Costs Raise Concerns, Report Says
articles.author: Nisha Gopalan
articles.summary: Meta Platforms has frozen hiring in its high-profile artificial intelligence division. The tech giant has hired 50-plus AI engineers and researchers for the four-team unit. Some analysts are worried that Meta's stock-based compensation costs would threaten shareholder returns. Meta's shares are little changed in premarket trading.

articles.title: The tech trade hits pause ahead of Nvidia earnings
articles.author: Hamza Shaban
articles.summary: This week's tech market pullback was triggered by negative headlines about the AI boom and the costs of the boom. The market is signaling a measure of unease with current measures of success in the AI industry. It's too early to forecast a major failure or correction.

articles.title: AI or die: Canada's existential moment in the age of augmented intelligence
articles.author: Special to Financial Post
articles.summary: Louis Tétu is the executive chair of Cove Solutions Inc., a company that sells AI solutions to international clients. He is concerned about the lack of focus on the application of AI in Canada. He believes the focus should be on building applications on top of AI models and integrating them effectively within businesses.

articles.title: Anthropic, DOE team up to spot dangerous nuclear chats
articles.author: Sam Sabin
articles.summary: Anthropic and the NNSA developed a new AI classifier for Claude. It can detect with 96% accuracy when a conversation is likely to cause some kind of harm. In tests, the classifier identified 94.8% of nuclear weapons queries and didn't label anything as false positive, but 5.2% of conversations were inaccurately labeled as dangerous.

articles.title: Observability For AI-Powered Applications
articles.author: Mohit Menghnani
articles.summary: Mohit Menghnani is an engineering leader and full-stack expert sharing insights on modern software, scalable systems and tech strategy. In an AI-powered world where models learn, adapt and behave unpredictably, traditional monitoring capabilities are insufficient. If you're building AI into your application, logging is essential for visibility, accountability and continuous improvement.

articles.title: AI-proof careers: These jobs won't be easily replaced
articles.author: Ivanhoe Newswire
articles.summary: 30% of employees fear AI could replace their jobs, but some jobs are still safe and you don't need a four-year degree to land them. Fast-growing jobs that require people skills, like flight attendants and hotel managers, aren't easily automated and don't require college education. Solar panel installers and wind turbine techs start at more than $50,000 a year.

articles.title: UniSC Pledges Ethical GenAI Use
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: UniSC is building a culture of integrity in the responsible and ethical use of artificial intelligence (AI) across its campuses. UniSC's Academic Integrity Matters employs a suite of methods to identify when generative AI has been used inappropriately in assessment tasks. It includes advanced plagiarism detection software, forensic linguistic analysis, and prompt-based comparison techniques.

articles.title: CoreWeave vs. Nvidia: What's the Better Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock to Buy?
articles.author: David Jagielski
articles.summary: CoreWeave rents out AI computing power, giving customers access to Nvidia's latest chips. CoreWeave has been one of the hottest new stocks to own this year. It's up 130% since going public back in March, but it's only a fraction of the size of Nvidia, which is valued at $4.3 trillion.

articles.title: Baltimore sees AI job growth amid overall employment decline
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is changing the job landscape in Baltimore. Learn which industries are embracing AI and what local experts predict for the future of work in the region.    iReporter.com will bring you all the latest news on AI and hiring trends in the Baltimore area.

articles.title: AI Meets Main Street
articles.author: Jessica Iannetta
articles.summary: The AI boom is touching nearly every inch of the Greater Baltimore business landscape. Here's how it is being used by the region's companies both large and small, and how it's changing their business models.       .   in

articles.title: Workshop provides Valley business owners hints on how to use A.I.
articles.author: Rick Dandes
articles.summary: StartUp Danville held a workshop and lecture on how to start a business using artificial intelligence on Wednesday morning. AI can tell your story more effectively and target your customers, Bernadette Boerckel, community outreach coordinator for Central Susquehanna Intermediate Unit, said.

articles.title: How AI Is Rewriting Broadcast Advertising Rules
articles.author: Jon Accarrino
articles.summary: TVNewsCheck hosted a webinar on AI and Optimizing Advertising in 2025. Industry leaders from Sinclair, IAB, Futuri, WideOrbit and Defiant LA discussed the opportunities and threats of AI in broadcast advertising. According to IAB's 2025 Digital Video Ad Spend & Strategy report, 86% of advertisers plan to use AI to create ads.

articles.title: The next generation of smart glasses is getting a push from AI
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: Big tech companies are going all-in on AI-enabled glasses for consumers who've grown increasingly dependent on technology.      Â   i.e. for consumers with growing preference for technology with artificial intelligence capabilities, such as smart glasses.

articles.title: Kuaishou's Profit Beats Views on Momentum in Ad Business, AI Monetization
articles.author: Sherry Qin
articles.summary: Chinese short-video app operator Kuaishou Technology reported slightly better-than-expected quarterly results as its advertising business regained momentum and its video-generation tool, Kling AI, continued to gain traction. Its second-quarter net profit rose 24% to 4.92 billion yuan equivalent to $685.6 million.

articles.title: Google Soundly Beaten By New AI Attacks—Change Your Browser
articles.author: Zak Doffman
articles.summary: Guardio set out to understand how exposed we are by new AI browsing tools and the extent to which they put us all at risk. The team set up three tests instructing AI to find and buy a product online, allowing AI to open a banking sign-in page and a new spin on the viral ClickFix attack. The results are alarming and you need to shore up your personal defenses before it's too late.

articles.title: AI is coming to a classroom near you: How it will be used at Ellis and Norwich Tech
articles.author: Connor Linskey
articles.summary: Harvard H. Ellis Technical High School in The Bulletin's coverage area will be using artificial intelligence in their curricula when the new school year starts on Aug. 28. This upcoming school year, teachers will use ChatGPT, Microsoft Copilot and Google Gemini to enhance their instruction.

articles.title: MIT study on AI profits rattles tech investors
articles.author: Madison Mills
articles.summary: 95% of organizations studied get zero return on their AI investment, according to a recent MIT study. Wall Street's biggest fear was validated by the study. The study comes at a challenging moment for Wall Street. August and September are seasonally volatile months for stocks.

articles.title: For Googlers, the pressure is on to use AI for everything — or get left behind
articles.author: Hugh Langley
articles.summary: Googlers at Google are encouraged to use AI in their daily work to improve their productivity. The company spent $2.4 billion on AI-related hiring last month. Google is using internal learning programs to cajole staff into experimenting with AI and using other AI tools to improve productivity.

articles.title: As AI shapes our future, few get to decide what that looks like
articles.author: enriquedans
articles.summary: In July, the White House published 'America's AI Action Plan', a 28-page document that reads like an industrial policy for a new arms race. It recasts artificial intelligence as a geopolitical race to 'win', not as a societal system to govern. The EU AI Act entered into force in August 2024 and phases in obligations through 2026.

articles.title: AI companions pose a dangerous threat to teens
articles.author: Beth Collums
articles.summary: According to new data, three in four teens have used artificial intelligence companions and one-half teens are using it a few times a month. The American Psychological Association has issued a warning for using AI for therapeutic purposes because instances of misuse and deadly advice are the dangerous norm for the current AI platforms.

articles.title: Louisiana education board backs AI in schools, sparking excitement and concerns
articles.author: Patrick Wall
articles.summary: Louisiana's board of education passed a resolution Wednesday calling on the state department of education to lead an 'ongoing AI research agenda' and train teachers and students on the technology. The state education department issued guidance for schools last year on how to safely adopt the technology and has been experimenting with AI programs in schools.

articles.title: Google's Pixel 10 phones raise ante on AI
articles.summary: Google unveils new lineup of Pixel smartphones with advanced artificial intelligence. Google is taking a swipe at Apple's Achilles' heel on the iPhone. The prices on all four Pixel 10 models will remain unchanged from last year's Pixel 9 generation, with the basic starting at $800 and the Pro selling for $1,000. The premium models will also include a "Super Res" option that deploys a grab bag of software and AI tricks to zoom up to 100 times.

articles.title: New Pixel 10 phones raise the ante on AI
articles.summary: Google unveils new line-up of Pixel smartphones with advanced artificial intelligence. Google is taking a swipe at Apple's Achilles' heel on the iPhone. All the Pixel 10s except for the foldable model will be in stores on August 28 and available starting October 9. The basic model starts at $800, the Pro version at $1,000 and the Pro XL at $1000.

articles.title: Exploring AI's Environmental Costs And Benefits
articles.author: Scoop
articles.summary: Panel of experts will discuss the opportunities and trade-offs of artificial intelligence (AI) for the environment at an event on Tuesday, 26 August, organised by University of Auckland research centre Juncture: Dialogues on Inclusive Capitalism at the Juncture event.

articles.title: Meta Freezes AI Hiring
articles.author: Opeoluwani Akintayo
articles.summary: Meta Platforms has paused hiring in its artificial intelligence division after bringing on more than 50 researchers and engineers. The company is preparing a solid structure for its new superintelligence efforts and undertaking yearly budgeting and planning exercises, a spokesperson for Meta Platforms said in an emailed statement.

articles.title: Next-Gen Academic AI Assistant: StudyPro Opens Free Beta Access to All Learners
articles.author: Plentisoft
articles.summary: AI Writer, Detector, Plagiarism Checker, and Paraphraser are now available in a limited-time open beta for students and educators worldwide. The beta is available globally and for a limited time only, giving early users full access to premium features before the platform's official launch.

articles.title: Meta freezes AI hiring amid team reshuffle
articles.author: Collins J. Okoth
articles.summary: Meta has stopped hiring in its AI division. The tech firm spent months wooing over 50 AI engineers and researchers. The hiring pause went into effect last week, coinciding with the broader restructuring of the AI team. The company's CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, became personally involved in recruiting AI engineers after the dismal release of the latest Llama models in April. He offered Andrew Tulloch a deal worth over $1.5 billion, but he declined. Zuckerberg hired Alexandr Wang to spearhead the hiring process.

articles.title: NZ film, TV industry weighs pros and cons of Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: RNZ
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence has become a commonly used tool in film and television production in Aotearoa. There are few rules or regulations in place to control the rapidly evolving tech. Many in the industry say AI has been a game-changer for them.

articles.title: Pixel 10 puts Apple on notice
articles.author: Ina Fried
articles.summary: Google on Wednesday updated its lineup of Pixel smartphones with new AI-powered features that put pressure on Apple ahead of its expected iPhone launch next month. Google has been using AI to improve photos for a decade, but this year's "Camera Coach" advances go beyond enhancing images after they're taken to offer help with framing and other core techniques key to good photography. Pixel 10 phones are the first to automatically embed content credentials into every photo.

articles.title: What Are the 3 Top Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks to Buy Right Now?
articles.author: Justin Pope
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices, Alphabet and ASML are good investments in artificial intelligence (AI) technology. ASML's stock has tumbled 30% off its all-time high, but it's still a good value. AMD's stock currently trades at a price-to-sales ratio of under 10.

articles.title: I am the CTO of Ordnance Survey and this is how this 230 year old organization is embracing AI
articles.author: Manish Jethwa
articles.summary: Ordnance Survey (OS) has been using AI for over a decade to improve its geospatial intelligence. The organization has been undergoing a significant digital transformation in the last few years. It's important for an organization with its legacy to embrace innovation, blending tradition and technology.

articles.title: Top 10 Picture-Conversion-to-Coloring-Page Tools-2025
articles.author: DNA India
articles.summary: A skeptical art teacher discovers the power of AI tools like "Artificrobot" and "Robot" in his art classes. He finds it useful in teaching students how to work with AI.    iReport.com will let you know more about it.

articles.title: The next generation of smart glasses is getting a push from AI
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: A number of companies are going all-in on artificial intelligence-enabled glasses. Google has partnered with Warby Parker for their upcoming Android XR glasses, while Chinese tech giants Alibaba and Xiaomi revealed pairs last month. Apple is rumoured to have a set in the works. Snap recently announced its forthcoming AI-enabled augmented reality Specs.

articles.title: Editorial: Artificial intelligence meets fried chicken at Wingstop
articles.author: The Editorial Board
articles.summary: By the end of this year, Wingstop expects its 2,000-plus stores across the U.S. to be using its new AI-powered 'Smart Kitchen' technology. It's a glimpse into how everyday businesses are adopting AI to improve efficiency and reduce their workforce.

articles.title: AI can't make companies rich: MIT study finds 95% of firms fail to profit from ...
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence was supposed to be the technology that launched businesses into a new era of efficiency, streamlined operations and untapped revenues. MIT study shows how far reality has lagged behind the dream. Across the United States, companies have invested in AI technology.

articles.title: Facebook and Instagram reels get AI voice translation and AI lip-sync features: Here's how it works
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Meta has rolled out AI-powered voice translation for Reels on Facebook and Instagram. The new feature allows creators to share their content in multiple languages without recording separate versions. It's now available worldwide. Creators can expand "Translate your voice with Meta AI" with their voice.

articles.title: Nvidia, Palantir, AMD, Meta Platforms, and Microsoft -- the Stock Market's Artificial Intelligence (AI) Titans -- Have a $23 Billion Warning for Wall Street
articles.author: Sean Williams
articles.summary: There is an estimated $15.7 trillion market for artificial intelligence (AI) by 2030. Industry-leading AI stocks like Nvidia, Palantir, Advanced Micro Devices, Meta Platforms, and Microsoft have been big sellers of their respective company's stock over the past five years. There has been no insider buying activity since mid-August 2020.

articles.title: Korea Times, AMCHAM to hold AI Forum Tuesday
articles.author: Korea Times
articles.summary: The Korea Times and the American Chamber of Commerce in Korea will co-host AI Forum 2025 to discuss Korea's future in the artificial intelligence industry. The event is scheduled for Tuesday at Conrad Seoul in Yeouido. The theme is "Global AI Race: Korea's Role in Shaping a Tech-Driven Economy".

articles.title: Deploy AI as a business process, not a product: Verizon Executive
articles.summary: Robert Le Busque is Verizon Business Regional Vice President of APAC. He talks to CNBC about ways to deploy AI in enterprises and empower human agents in the workplace. He is also the CEO of Verizon Business in APAC, which is based in Australia.

articles.title: DEPOP IN FULL SWING-AI. BIO WEAPON DEATH JABS, ETC. SHOULD REACH THEIR 'MAGIK' NUMBER OF ONLY 200 MILLION WORLDWIDE BY 2030...
articles.author: Alicia Lutz
articles.summary: BBN, Aug. 19, 2025 – AI robots will exterminate humans because they learned it from us. BBN, August 18, 2025 - Vaccine mass extermination program to clear out humans.  A.I. is everywhere and beginning to control everything.

articles.title: 🌱 Patch AM: Kaiser Permanente's Mountain View facility undergoes major renovations
articles.author: Patch AM Team
articles.summary: HireEZ appoints Dr. Tianlong Chen as Chief AI Scientist. Kaiser Permanente's downtown Mountain View facility is undergoing a six-month construction project. Stephen Curry has taken a new role as a Performance Advisor at Google, based in Mountain View. Google is preparing for its antitrust trial.

articles.title: Meta's hot AI hiring summer is over
articles.author: Lee Chong Ming
articles.summary: Meta has put the brakes on its AI hiring spree. The tech giant is "creating a solid structure" for its new superintelligence efforts. Wall Street is scrutinizing how much Meta is spending to compete in the AI race. Morgan Stanley analysts wrote that Meta's labor costs are climbing as the company leans heavily on stock grants to recruit AI talent.

articles.title: Sam Altman Says That Less Than 1% Of User-AI Relationships Are Unhealthy But That's Still Jittery For Far-Flung Mental Health
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: According to Sam Altman, less than 1% of user-AI relationships could be construed as unhealthy. This percentage is based on an ad hoc basis and has an upper bound of 1%. ChatGPT has over 700 million weekly active users, and when added to the volume of users using competing AIs such as Claude, Gemini, Llama, and others, the grand total is somewhere in the billions.

articles.title: Merkel Sees Ai as an Opportunity for Bundesliga Marketing
articles.summary: DFL Managing Director Steffen Merkel sees artificial intelligence (AI) as an important component for successful international marketing of the Bundesliga. He believes AI is an important part of the future of football marketing in the world of the German Bundesliga and in particular in the international market.

articles.title: LTTS unveils GenAI framework to speed product development
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: The framework combines generative AI with conventional AI. It is based on a combination of both AI and conventional AI techniques.    for more information, visit: http://www.justin.com/the-founcil-on-automation-and-machine-intelligence/

articles.title: Meta puts the brakes on its massive AI talent spending spree
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Meta Platforms has stopped hiring for its AI division. The company had acquired a wave of high-priced AI researchers and engineers recently. It is ending a spending spree that saw the company acquire a lot of AI researchers.      Â

articles.title: Meta Pauses Hiring in Artificial Intelligence Division After Rapid Expansion – [your]NEWS
articles.author: COMFORT OGBONNA
articles.summary: Meta Platforms has temporarily halted new hiring within its artificial intelligence division. The company has recently added more than 50 researchers and engineers to its growing team. The pause is not a signal of retreat, but an effort to build a sustainable foundation for its 'superintelligence' initiatives.

articles.title: Using AI in the classroom
articles.summary: There is a note in the freshman orientation packet that says AI is not allowed in high school. Mary Jo explains that artificial intelligence plays a role in certain aspects of online searching, but it is not universal. She suggests talking to your teachers about it.

articles.title: I made an AI friend. It was scary.
articles.summary: More and more people have their own AI-powered chatbot with whom they talk, play games, watch movies or exchange racy selfies. Experts and regulators are worried that the rise of AI chatbots could heavily impact human interactions. They are concerned that it could reduce the time spent on genuine social interactions.

articles.title: NEC develops robot control technology using AI to achieve safe, efficient autonomous movement even at ...
articles.author: JCN Newswire
articles.summary: NEC has developed technology that utilizes AI to enable safe, efficient autonomous control of robot movement even in complex environments with many obstacles. NEC's in-house demonstrations of this technology have confirmed that a robot's travel time can be shortened.    "NEC" is a trading stock on the Tokyo Stock Exchange.

articles.title: Lyken.AI Announces Align Wellness as New Client for PaaS Platform Covering 60 Clinics Across North America
articles.author: Hastings Tribune
articles.summary: Lyken will provide AI agent infrastructure for the automation of the reception area, sales support and customer loyalty in Align's network of rehabilitation and wellness clinics in North America as a new customer for the PaaS platform. Lyken wins Align Wellness with a network of 60 clinics.

articles.title: Nexo Launches AI Tool for Real-Time Crypto Insights and Portfolio Access
articles.author: Bitcoin
